headline: Danaher Lifts 2025 Earnings Outlook Amid Biotech Growth, Cost Discipline
summary: Danaher Corp (NYSE:DHR) on Tuesday reported second-quarter 2025 sales of $5.94 billion, up 3.5% year-over-year, beating the consensus of $5.84 billion. The life science giant reported adjusted earnings of $1.80 per share, beating the consensus of $1.64. Non-GAAP core revenue increased 1.5% year over year, compared to the expectations of a growth in low single digits year over year. Operating cash flow was $1.3 billion, and non-GAAP free cash flow was $1.1 billion. Danaher's second-quarter adjust

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday: RTX, Lockheed Martin, Coca-Cola, GM
summary: ? Coca-Cola (KO): The soda maker reported mixed quarterly results, but nudged up its annual earnings outlook. The company confirmed it will roll out a cane-sugar Coke option. ↘️ RTX (RTX): Results from the aerospace and defense company beat projections, but it sliced its earnings outlook, as tariffs sting.

headline: Danaher shares slip despite Q2 beat, annual profit outlook hike
summary: Investing.com -- Danaher (NYSE:DHR) delivered stronger-than-expected second-quarter results and lifted its full-year profit outlook. Still, the company’s shares fell over 2% in premarket trading on Tuesday.

headline: Danaher: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.64 per share. The industrial and medical device maker posted revenue of $5.94 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts.

raw.headline: Danaher: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.64 per share. The industrial and medical device maker posted revenue of $5.94 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts.

headline: Danaher’s (NYSE:DHR) Q2 Sales Top Estimates But Quarterly Revenue Guidance Slightly Misses Expectations
summary: Diversified science and technology company Danaher (NYSE:DHR) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 3.4% year on year to $5.94 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $5.94 billion was less impressive, coming in 1% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.80 per share was 9.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Danaher’s (NYSE:DHR) Q2 Sales Top Estimates But Quarterly Revenue Guidance Slightly Misses Expectations
raw.summary: Diversified science and technology company Danaher (NYSE:DHR) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 3.4% year on year to $5.94 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $5.94 billion was less impressive, coming in 1% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.80 per share was 9.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Danaher Announces Transition Plan for Chief Financial Officer
summary: Danaher Corporation (NYSE: DHR), a leading global life sciences and diagnostics innovator, today announced that Matthew Gugino, currently Group Chief Financial Officer of the Company's Life Sciences Innovations Group and Vice President of Financial Planning & Analysis, will succeed Matthew McGrew as Danaher's Chief Financial Officer effective February 28th, 2026. headline: Alphabet and Tesla Earnings, Home Sales and More: What to Watch This Week
summary: Earnings season rolls on this week, with the first of the Magnificent Seven tech names to report, Tesla and Google parent Alphabet. New economic data will shed more light on how tariffs are affecting consumer and business spending, and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is slated to speak on bank regulation.
